snippet.textDisplay: These "pundits" love to latch on to a narrative early on in a performance and run with it. Yes Arsenal started better, but in reality the game was dominated by Chelsea. They actually tried to play and thoroughly deserved to win, especially when you dominate the ball playing against Arsenal AT the Emirates.

snippet.textDisplay:
Arsenal are on no honeymoon period with Arteta with the new work ethic as some are putting it. With Emery there was always that sense of getting away with risks during the 20 game unbeaten run. Same with Ole at united . I was not for the idea of Arteta but the more I learnt and hear him speak about what he was trying to do. He said energy & commitment are some of the basics of playing in his side. Tony adams today revealed he has hope because apparently the 5 years he spent at arsenal , his interests in working with coaching staff made him feel more of a manager than player....it explains why he applied for the job 2 years ago
..and more importantly he keeps saying it himself that the players are employing what they are working on in training, the more convinced i am he knows what he is doing especially with his one on one background of improving some man city players and also being the key tactician for some of their near miss games. It might actually work out better coming from losses and building into wins...when they do they might just be very consistent at it.
snippet.textOriginal:
Arsenal are on no honeymoon period with Arteta with the new work ethic as some are putting it. With Emery there was always that sense of getting away with risks during the 20 game unbeaten run. Same with Ole at united . I was not for the idea of Arteta but the more I learnt and hear him speak about what he was trying to do. He said energy & commitment are some of the basics of playing in his side. Tony adams today revealed he has hope because apparently the 5 years he spent at arsenal , his interests in working with coaching staff made him feel more of a manager than player....it explains why he applied for the job 2 years ago
..and more importantly he keeps saying it himself that the players are employing what they are working on in training, the more convinced i am he knows what he is doing especially with his one on one background of improving some man city players and also being the key tactician for some of their near miss games. It might actually work out better coming from losses and building into wins...when they do they might just be very consistent at it.

snippet.textDisplay: Arsenal have definitely improved.  They had structure and organisation for the majority of the game, and played with confidence in the opening 30 minutes.  They also show more fight and get stuck in.  We lost due to a goalkeeper error and another poor defensive decision by Mustafi.  Still so much to work on but I do think with more sessions under Arteta and some recruitment in January Arsenal could start to build something closer to what they were before.   People need to remember that this is Arteta's second game after having only had a few training sessions with this squad.  He's done well with the time he's had.
snippet.textOriginal: Arsenal have definitely improved.  They had structure and organisation for the majority of the game, and played with confidence in the opening 30 minutes.  They also show more fight and get stuck in.  We lost due to a goalkeeper error and another poor defensive decision by Mustafi.  Still so much to work on but I do think with more sessions under Arteta and some recruitment in January Arsenal could start to build something closer to what they were before.   People need to remember that this is Arteta's second game after having only had a few training sessions with this squad.  He's done well with the time he's had.

As a Chelsea fan, I believe Chelsea are in trouble. Even thought we won a London Derby. but any team can beat us by reason of team selection.
